title: The Black Keys - Attack & Release - slavetothesounds FLAC
description:
This is a great all around album. If you know the Black Keys then it&#039;s more of what you love, medium-hard blues rock, with a little bit extra. A perfect example of how a band can evolve into something slightly different without changing all the best parts that they&#039;re fans have come to love. It&#039;s produced by Danger Mouse, one of my favorite producers, and I love what he&#039;s done with this album.

Here&#039;s the track list:

CD: The Black Keys - Attack & Release
YEAR: 2008

01. All You Ever Wanted [0:02:56.19]
02. I Got Mine [0:03:59.11]
03. Strange Times [0:03:10.24]
04. Psychotic Girl [0:04:10.53]
05. Lies [0:03:59.01]
06. Remember When (Side A) [0:03:21.39]
07. Remember When (Side B) [0:02:11.00]
08. Same Old Thing [0:03:09.22]
09. So He Won&#039;t Break [0:04:14.22]
10. Oceans And Streams [0:03:26.24]
11. Things Ain&#039;t Like They Used To Be [0:04:36.31]

Also, check out their older stuff, too. This is they&#039;re sixth album and I think these guys are what the White Stripes used to be, back before Icky Thump (not a fan of that album). Maybe I&#039;ll upload De Stijl later for those of you that don&#039;t know what I&#039;m talking about. And if anyone has anymore Black Keys CDs that they could upload in FLAC I&#039;d be really grateful. All the rest of my Keys albums are in mp3. I&#039;m open to requests, contributions, and suggestions in terms of music from anyone that likes my taste. I&#039;ll have a few more albums going up later as each torrent gets a couple of seeds I&#039;ll start a new one.

On the coming up list are:
Black Rebel Motorcycle Club - Howl
Gorillaz - Demon Days
Bob Dylan Live 1966 - The Royal Albert Hall Concert
White Stripes - De Stijl

And Black Mountain - In the Future went up earlier today if you missed it.
I&#039;ll have a lot more when I get back to my full CD collection at home in a couple weeks as well. And who knows what I&#039;ll pick up between now and then...

One more thing - I&#039;ve been looking for a FLAC torrent of Comus&#039;s First Utterance if anyone has it. There used to be one but it looks like it&#039;s been long dead.

Enjoy, and purchase a Black Keys CD if you like it. Or some merch. Or see a show. Let&#039;s support the artists we love. :)
